text:
You raise your blade and strike through the last embers. Not with hatred — but with mercy. The flame dies with a whisper, and all light recedes.

The world does not collapse. It sleeps. Cities vanish under moss, and rivers run still. But deep within the dark, something stirs — not evil, not fire, but *memory*. In choosing silence, you grant the world the right to forget... and perhaps, to choose for itself.
lore: This is the ending chosen by those who see fire not as salvation, but as a curse. In extinguishing it, you defy the cycle. But who will remember you, when even the stars forget to shine?
